user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtTest_AddCommon:
```c
void UtTest_AddCommon(void (*Test)(void), void (*Setup)(void), void (*Teardown)(void), const char *TestName,
                      uint32 EntryType)
{
    UtTestDataBaseEntry_t UtTestDataBaseEntry;

    memset(&UtTestDataBaseEntry, 0, sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry));
    UtTestDataBaseEntry.Test     = Test;
    UtTestDataBaseEntry.Setup    = Setup;
    UtTestDataBaseEntry.Teardown = Teardown;
    if (TestName != NULL)
    {
        strncpy(UtTestDataBaseEntry.TestName, TestName, sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry.TestName) - 1);
    }

    UT_BSP_Lock();
    UtList_Add(UtAssert_Global.DataBasePtr, &UtTestDataBaseEntry, sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry_t), EntryType);
    UT_BSP_Unlock();
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
        strncpy(UtTestDataBaseEntry.TestName, TestName, sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry.TestName) - 1);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call uses strncpy(dst, TestName, sizeof(dst)-1) without any guarantee that the source object TestName is null‑terminated within that many bytes or that its buffer is at least that long. If TestName points to a smaller char array (or a non‑terminated string) shorter than sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry.TestName)-1, strncpy will attempt to read up to that many bytes from TestName and can read beyond the source object’s bounds — violating Rule 21.17.
